Key Match Events: England scored the lowest total registered on this ground in a one-day international at 156 all out
Sri Lanka won the match by eight wickets
Pathum Nissanka scored 77 not out and Sadeera Samarawickrama scored 52
Pre-Game Insights: England made three changes for the game, with the aim of bolstering their batting
Post-Match Reflections: England have now lost four games, their confidence, their reputation and at times it seems all reason, and it isn't over yet
England's world champions are no more
After four defeats from five it seems unfathomably cruel, forcing this hollow shell of a team to continue parading around India for another two and a half weeks
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the first time in ODIs, and the first time in any format for more than a century, England picked a team without any players younger than 30
Many of those who won the title in 2019 are still in the side but England’s world champions are no more
Others: England lost all 10 wickets for 111 runs
Joe Root ran himself out in search of a nonexistent run
Ben Stokes was nearly caught, brilliantly, at backward square leg on 12
Adil Rashid was run out at the non-striker’s end off a wide while not attempting a run
